about.summary: The 'ggplot2' package is excellent and flexible for elegant data visualization in R. However the default generated plots requires some formatting before we can send them for publication. Furthermore, to customize a 'ggplot', the syntax is opaque and this raises the level of difficulty for researchers with no advanced R programming skills. 'ggpubr' provides some easy-to-use functions for creating and customizing 'ggplot2'- based publication ready plots.

name: r-ggpubr
raw_recipe:
{% set version = "0.2.5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-ggpubr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ggpubr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ggpubr/ggpubr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 47414185bb20420481caa763191bca3542217cd913f419fa9a954868eb85634d

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{posix}}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-cowplot
    - r-dplyr >=0.7.1
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggrepel
    - r-ggsci
    - r-ggsignif
    - r-glue
    - r-gridextra
    - r-magrittr
    - r-polynom
    - r-purrr
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-tidyr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-cowplot
    - r-dplyr >=0.7.1
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggrepel
    - r-ggsci
    - r-ggsignif
    - r-glue
    - r-gridextra
    - r-magrittr
    - r-polynom
    - r-purrr
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-tidyr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('ggpubr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ggpubr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://rpkgs.datanovia.com/ggpubr/
  license: GPL-2
  summary: The 'ggplot2' package is excellent and flexible for elegant data visualization in
    R. However the default generated plots requires some formatting before we can send
    them for publication. Furthermore, to customize a 'ggplot', the syntax is opaque
    and this raises the level of difficulty for researchers with no advanced R programming
    skills. 'ggpubr' provides some easy-to-use functions for creating and customizing
    'ggplot2'- based publication ready plots.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: ggpubr

# Description: The 'ggplot2' package is excellent and flexible for elegant data visualization in R. However the default generated plots requires some formatting before we can send them for publication. Furthermore, to customize a 'ggplot', the syntax is opaque and this raises the level of difficulty for researchers with no advanced R programming skills. 'ggpubr' provides some easy-to-use functions for creating and customizing 'ggplot2'- based publication ready plots.

about.summary: The 'ggplot2' package is excellent and flexible for elegant data visualization in R. However the default generated plots requires some formatting before we can send them for publication. Furthermore, to customize a 'ggplot', the syntax is opaque and this raises the level of difficulty for researchers with no advanced R programming skills. 'ggpubr' provides some easy-to-use functions for creating and customizing 'ggplot2'- based publication ready plots.
